content.question: The number of minutes of daylight per day for a certain city can be modeled by the function <math alttext="D"><semantics><mi>D</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> given by <math alttext="D open parentheses t close parentheses equals 160 cos open parentheses fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 365 end fraction open parentheses t minus 172 close parentheses close parentheses plus 729"><semantics><mrow><mi>D</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>160</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>365</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>172</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>729</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is the day of the year for <math alttext="1 less or equal than t less or equal than 365"><semantics><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>365</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following best describes the behavior of <math alttext="D open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>D</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> on day <math alttext="150"><semantics><mn>150</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​The number of minutes of daylight per day is increasing at a decreasing rate.
​The number of minutes of daylight per day is decreasing at a decreasing rate.
​The number of minutes of daylight per day is increasing at an increasing rate.
​The number of minutes of daylight per day is decreasing at an increasing rate.

content.answer: ​The number of minutes of daylight per day is increasing at a decreasing rate.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
